response.raw:
Here is the memo:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
To: Elementary School Teachers and Staff
From: [Your Name], Senior Elementary School Teacher
Subject: Involving Parent Volunteers and Older Students in Children's Activities

To facilitate more focused and complex play among our elementary students, we will be implementing a new program to involve parent volunteers and older students (4th-5th graders) in leading small group activities with the younger children (K-3rd grade). Having additional adult and student leaders will allow us to:
• Break the children into smaller groups based on interests and skill levels
• Introduce more challenging games, projects, and activities that build key academic and social skills
• Provide more individualized attention and guidance to keep children engaged
• Model good social interactions and facilitate positive peer relationships

We are looking for parent volunteers to assist in the classroom for 1-2 hours per week. The older student leaders will be chosen by teachers based on maturity and responsibility. They will spend 1 hour per week (during lunch/recess time) leading activities with a small group of younger students, under the supervision of a teacher or parent volunteer.

If you have any suggestions for educational games and activities well-suited for this format, or if you know of parents interested in volunteering, please let me know. We will be holding a training next month for all parent and student leaders participating in this new program. 

Thank you for your support and cooperation as we work to enrich our students' learning experience.
</OUTPUT_TEXT>

<OUTPUT_TEXT>
To: Elementary School Teachers and Staff
From: [Your Name], Senior Elementary School Teacher
Subject: Involving Parent Volunteers and Older Students in Children's Activities

To facilitate more focused and complex play among our elementary students, we will be implementing a new program to involve parent volunteers and older students (4th-5th graders) in leading small group activities with the younger children (K-3rd grade). Having additional adult and student leaders will allow us to:
• Break the children into smaller groups based on interests and skill levels
• Introduce more challenging games, projects, and activities that build key academic and social skills
• Provide more individualized attention and guidance to keep children engaged
• Model good social interactions and facilitate positive peer relationships

We are looking for parent volunteers to assist in the classroom for 1-2 hours per week. The older student leaders will be chosen by teachers based on maturity and responsibility. They will spend 1 hour per week (during lunch/recess time) leading activities with a small group of younger students, under the supervision of a teacher or parent volunteer.

If you have any suggestions for educational games and activities well-suited for this format, or if you know of parents interested in volunteering, please let me know. We will be holding a training next month for all parent and student leaders participating in this new program. 

Thank you for your support and cooperation as we work to enrich our students' learning experience.
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
